name: workspace
description: Smart, Fast and Extensible Build System.

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the workspace?

style.description: The file extension to be used for style files.

x-prompt.message: Which stylesheet format would you like to use?

directory.description: The directory name to create the workspace in.

packageManager.description: The package manager used to install dependencies.

cli.description: CLI used for generating code and running tasks

schema.title: Creates applications in a new workspace
schema.description: Creates applications in a new workspace.

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

style.description: The file extension to be used for style files.

x-prompt.message: Which stylesheet format would you like to use?

standaloneConfig.description: Split the project configurations into `<projectRoot>/project.json` rather than including it inside `workspace.json`.

packageManager.description: The package manager used to install dependencies.

generators.description: Create application in an empty workspace.

generators.name: move

schema.title: Nx Move
schema.description: Move a project to another folder in the workspace.

projectName.description: The name of the project to move.

destination.description: The folder to move the project into.

importPath.description: The new import path to use in the `tsconfig.base.json`.

updateImportPath.description: Should the generator update the import path to reflect the new location?

generators.description: Move an application or library to another folder.

schema.title: Nx Remove
schema.description: Remove a project from the workspace.

examples.description: Force removal of `my-feature-lib` from the workspace

projectName.description: The name of the project to remove.

forceRemove.description: When `true`, forces removal even if the project is still in use.

importPath.description: The library name used at creation time

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the workspace?

cli.description: CLI used for generating code and running tasks.

style.description: The file extension to be used for style files.

preset.description: What to create in the new workspace.

nxCloud.description: Connect the workspace to the free tier of the distributed cache provided by Nx Cloud.

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

packageManager.description: The package manager used to install dependencies.

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the library?

directory.description: A directory where the lib is placed.

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

unitTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for unit tests.

tags.description: Add tags to the library (used for linting).

skipTsConfig.description: Do not update `tsconfig.json` for development experience.

testEnvironment.description: The test environment to use if `unitTestRunner` is set to `jest`.

importPath.description: The library name used to import it, like `@myorg/my-awesome-lib`.

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

strict.description: Whether to enable `tsconfig` strict mode or not.

skipBabelrc.description: Do not generate `.babelrc` file. Useful for Node libraries that are not compiled by Babel.

setParserOptionsProject.description: Whether or not to configure the ESLint `parserOptions.project` option. We do not do this by default for lint performance reasons.

standaloneConfig.description: Split the project configuration into `<projectRoot>/project.json` rather than including it inside `workspace.json`.

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the workspace generator?

generators.name: run-commands

schema.title: Create a custom target to run any command
schema.description: Create a custom target to run any command.

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use to invoke the command?

project.x-prompt: What project does the target belong to?

command.x-prompt: What command would you like to run?

cwd.description: Current working directory of the command.

outputs.description: Allows you to specify where the build artifacts are stored. This allows Nx Cloud to pick them up correctly, in the case that the build artifacts are placed somewhere other than the top level dist folder.

envFile.description: Env files to be loaded before executing the commands.

generators.description: Generates a target to run any command in the terminal.

generators.name: convert-to-nx-project

schema.title: Create a custom target to run any command
schema.description: Create a custom target to run any command.

examples.description: Convert the `my-feature-lib` project to use `project.json` file instead of `workspace.json`
Convert all projects in `workspace.json` to separate `project.json` files

generators.description: Moves a project's configuration outside of `workspace.json`.

name.x-prompt: What name of your npm package?

executors.name: run-commands

schema.title: Run Commands
schema.description: Run any custom commands with Nx.

commands.description: Commands to run in child process.

command.description: Command to run in child process.

forwardAllArgs.description: Whether arguments should be forwarded when interpolation is not present.

description.description: An optional description useful for inline documentation purposes. It is not used as part of the execution of the command.

command.description: Command to run in child process.

readyWhen.description: String to appear in `stdout` or `stderr` that indicates that the task is done. When running multiple commands, this option can only be used when `parallel` is set to `true`. If not specified, the task is done when all the child processes complete.

args.description: Extra arguments. You can pass them as follows: nx run project:target --args='--wait=100'. You can then use {args.wait} syntax to interpolate them in the workspace config file. See example [above](#chaining-commands-interpolating-args-and-setting-the-cwd)

envFile.description: You may specify a custom .env file path.

color.description: Use colors when showing output of command.

outputPath.description: Allows you to specify where the build artifacts are stored. This allows Nx Cloud to pick them up correctly, in the case that the build artifacts are placed somewhere other than the top level dist folder.

cwd.description: Current working directory of the commands. If it's not specified the commands will run in the workspace root, if a relative path is specified the commands will run in that path relative to the workspace root and if it's an absolute path the commands will run in that path.

executors.description: Run any custom commands with Nx.

executors.name: counter

schema.title: Counter
schema.description: A dummy executor useful for E2E tests.

executors.description: A dummy executor useful for E2E tests.

executors.name: run-script

schema.title: Run Script
schema.description: Run any NPM script of a project in the project's root directory.

script.description: An npm script name in the `package.json` file of the project (e.g., `build`).

executors.description: Run an NPM script using Nx.
